title: Infection biology: What makes Helicobacter so adaptable?

title_detail.value: Infection biology: What makes Helicobacter so adaptable?

summary: The bacterial pathogen Helicobacter pylori owes its worldwide distribution to its genetic adaptability. Microbiologists have identified an enzyme that plays a vital role in the flexible control of global gene expression in the species.
